resources.string: For devices without root, you need to use adb to start AxManager (requires computer connection). This process needs to be repeated every time the device restarted.
`%1$s`\n\nThere are some other considerations, please confirm that you have read the help first.
On Android 11 or above, you can enable Wireless debugging and start AxManager directly from your device, without connecting to a computer.\n\nPlease view step-by-step guide first.

Please enable \"Wireless debugging\" in \"Developer options\". \"Wireless debugging\" is automatically disabled when network changes.\n\nNote, do not disable \"Developer options\" or \"USB debugging\", or AxManager will be stopped.
MIUI users may need to switch notification style to \"Android\" from \"Notification\" - \"Notification shade\" in system settings.
Otherwise, you may not able to enter paring code from the notification.

In addition, AxManager can be started automatically on boot. If not, please check if your system or third-party tools have restricted AxManager.
You can refer to %s.
